channel.title: Dave's linkblog feed
channel.description: My linkblog has been around in various locations for many years.

item.description: Trump fan featured in Biden ad admits assaulting officers with bear spray on Jan 6.
item.source:markdown: Trump fan featured in Biden ad admits assaulting officers with bear spray on Jan 6.

item.description: Etain in town of Ulster begins selling recreational cannabis, becoming third licensed dispensary in Ulster County.
item.source:markdown: Etain in town of Ulster begins selling recreational cannabis, becoming third licensed dispensary in Ulster County.

item.description: Sarah Huckabee Sanders forced us to think of her as a mom. I don't think that works out very well in her favor, probably best not to go there.
item.source:markdown: Sarah Huckabee Sanders forced us to think of her as a mom. I don't think that works out very well in her favor, probably best not to go there.

item.description: Robinson under pressure to withdraw from gubernatorial race. They don't say what the "damning news story" is.
item.source:markdown: Robinson under pressure to withdraw from gubernatorial race. They don't say what the "damning news story" is.

item.description: Jeff Jarvis nails what journalism isn't doing. They should be making clear at every step that Trump is trying to initiate a race war, and is coming close to it, and if they don't get it together soon, it'll happen without any accurate reporting in advance. That is the story.
item.source:markdown: Jeff Jarvis nails what journalism isn't doing. They should be making clear at every step that Trump is trying to initiate a race war, and is coming close to it, and if they don't get it together soon, it'll happen without any accurate reporting in advance. That is the story.

item.description: $25 Harris yard sign.
item.source:markdown: $25 Harris yard sign.

item.description: Bluesky addresses trust and safety concerns around abuse, spam, and more, but when is the second instance coming? How can they claim to be distributed?
item.source:markdown: Bluesky addresses trust and safety concerns around abuse, spam, and more, but when is the second instance coming? How can they claim to be distributed?

item.description: The unreasonable effectiveness of simple HTML.
item.source:markdown: The unreasonable effectiveness of simple HTML.

item.description: Podcast: Let's use feeds to hook together pieces of the twittersphere.
item.source:markdown: Podcast: Let's use feeds to hook together pieces of the twittersphere.

item.description: Let's go on a ride on Hudson River bike path. (A number of years ago when I lived in NYC.)

item.description: Shouting fire in a crowded theater.
item.source:markdown: Shouting fire in a crowded theater.

item.description: WordCamp US & Ecosystem Thinking.
item.source:markdown: WordCamp US & Ecosystem Thinking.

item.description: The Worst Magazine In America. I subscribed to the Atlantic a couple of weeks ago, because I found myself reading a lot of their stories for free and decided to use the money I was spending on the Washington Post to broaden my horizons.
item.source:markdown: The Worst Magazine In America. I subscribed to the Atlantic a couple of weeks ago, because I found myself reading a lot of their stories for free and decided to use the money I was spending on the Washington Post to broaden my horizons.

item.description: John Grisham on death row prisoner: ‘Texas is about to execute innocent man.’
item.source:markdown: John Grisham on death row prisoner: ‘Texas is about to execute innocent man.’

item.description: What Happens in Springfield Won’t Stay in Springfield.
item.source:markdown: What Happens in Springfield Won’t Stay in Springfield.

item.description: These lifelong Republicans say they're finally done with Trump.
item.source:markdown: These lifelong Republicans say they're finally done with Trump.

item.description: Harris calls ‘hateful rhetoric’ surrounding Springfield ‘a crying shame.’
item.source:markdown: Harris calls ‘hateful rhetoric’ surrounding Springfield ‘a crying shame.’

item.description: Mozilla exits the fediverse and will shutter its Mastodon server in December.

item.description: Millions Have Amnesia About the Worst of Trump’s Presidency. Memory Experts Explain Why.
item.source:markdown: Millions Have Amnesia About the Worst of Trump’s Presidency. Memory Experts Explain Why.

item.description: Coincidence. CSS was first proposed the same day in 1994 that I started my blog. October 10. Almost 30 years ago.
item.source:markdown: Coincidence. CSS was first proposed the same day in 1994 that I started my blog. October 10\. Almost 30 years ago.

item.description: To fight climate change, we must create political will.
item.source:markdown: To fight climate change, we must create political will.

item.description: Scripting News: How I cross-post to Threads. I move my linkblog posts to micro.blog via RSS, and it cross-posts to Threads via their API.
item.source:markdown: Scripting News: How I cross-post to Threads. I move my linkblog posts to micro.blog via RSS, and it cross-posts to Threads via their API.

item.description: Pretty sure I understand why Jack Dorsey is disappointed with Bluesky. The mistake at Twitter was taking responsibility for enforcing decorum, which is diseconomic. A fully decentralized system is different. That was why he funded Bluesky, to make a social web that wouldn't have at its center a company responsible for content.
item.source:markdown: Pretty sure I understand why Jack Dorsey is disappointed with Bluesky. The mistake at Twitter was taking responsibility for enforcing decorum, which is diseconomic. A fully decentralized system is different. That was why he funded Bluesky, to make a social web that wouldn't have at its center a company responsible for content.

item.description: Learning the basics of Fedify.
item.source:markdown: Learning the basics of Fedify.

item.description: Has it ever been suggested that journalists take an oath, similar to the one the President takes to: "preserve, protect and defend the Constitution of the United States." Could be voluntary. Sports reporters might take a different oath.
item.source:markdown: Has it ever been suggested that journalists take an oath, similar to the one the President takes to: "preserve, protect and defend the Constitution of the United States." Could be voluntary. Sports reporters might take a different oath.

item.source:markdown: Comments on Manton's piece on cross-posting in the twitterverse.

item.description: If you ever think there’s no beauty in the details, watch this episode of The Bear. It stands alone.

item.description: “Laura Loomer is a crazy conspiracy theorist who regularly utters disgusting garbage intended to divide Republicans. A DNC plant couldn’t do a better job than she is doing to hurt President Trump’s chances of winning re-election.”
item.source:markdown: “Laura Loomer is a crazy conspiracy theorist who regularly utters disgusting garbage intended to divide Republicans. A DNC plant couldn’t do a better job than she is doing to hurt President Trump’s chances of winning re-election.”

item.description: Manton Reece: Toward a common posting API.
item.source:markdown: Manton Reece: Toward a common posting API.

item.description: I used to think of Twitter as a coral reef, but its role as a world wide notification system is fading, and we haven't replaced it with anything. I wrote this in 2007 when the utility of Twitter was just becoming apparent.
item.source:markdown: I used to think of Twitter as a coral reef, but its role as a world wide notification system is fading, and we haven't replaced it with anything. I wrote this in 2007 when the utility of Twitter was just becoming apparent.

item.description: "Well, as I said, you’re going to hear a bunch of lies. And that’s not actually a surprising fact." Exactly right. That's why Trump lying is not news in 2024.
item.source:markdown: "Well, as I said, you’re going to hear a bunch of lies. And that’s not actually a surprising fact." Exactly right. That's why Trump lying is not news in 2024.

item.description: NYT piece on Trump as star of The Apprentice.
item.source:markdown: NYT piece on Trump as star of The Apprentice.

item.description: “Our job was to make him look legitimate, to make him look like there was something behind it, even though we pretty much all knew that there wasn’t,” one producer said.
item.source:markdown: “Our job was to make him look legitimate, to make him look like there was something behind it, even though we pretty much all knew that there wasn’t,” one producer said.

item.description: Journalists: "He's lying again" isn't news.
item.source:markdown: Journalists: "He's lying again" isn't news.

item.description: If Trump is GOP anomaly, why are the denunciations from Republican leaders so soft and mealy-mouthed?
item.source:markdown: If Trump is GOP anomaly, why are the denunciations from Republican leaders so soft and mealy-mouthed?

item.description: Please be kind, but wtf is block-based design? Explain it slowly as a person who loves blogging and has been making software for blogging for almost 30 years. I don't know what you all mean. Also I'm a writer too. :-)
item.source:markdown: Please be kind, but wtf is block-based design? Explain it slowly as a person who loves blogging and has been making software for blogging for almost 30 years. I don't know what you all mean. Also I'm a writer too. :-)

item.description: I agree we shouldn't demean Trump voters. As long as we're all Americans. We should help each other.
item.source:markdown: I agree we shouldn't demean Trump voters. As long as we're all Americans. We should help each other.

item.description: 2024 Emmy Nominations: Full List of Nominees.
item.source:markdown: 2024 Emmy Nominations: Full List of Nominees.

item.description: Could we agree that ChatGPT can ingest everything that's in Wikipedia? I particularly want the images. I'd like to ask for a picture of Chuck Berry, and be able to put him in a scene with the Wordle Kitty. That seems pretty harmless. The news industry could hardly object.
item.source:markdown: Could we agree that ChatGPT can ingest everything that's in Wikipedia? I particularly want the images. I'd like to ask for a picture of Chuck Berry, and be able to put him in a scene with the Wordle Kitty. That seems pretty harmless. The news industry could hardly object.
